alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:25AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM AKDT TUESDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER BETWEEN CROOKED CREEK AND NAPAIMUTE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Kuskokwim between Crooked Creek and Napaimute. * WHEN...Until 945 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Kuskokwim River is imminent or occurring. Flooding as well as large blocks of ice being pushed onshore. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 943 AM AKDT, The River Watch Team reports an ice jam on the Kuskokwim downstream of Crooked Creek, which is currently causing flooding. As the ice jam moves downstream, additional flooding is likely between Crooked Creek and Napaimute. Impounding water due to the ice jam will cause rapid river rises upstream of the jam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
